question: Will my files be deleted when a system undergoes a complete data center shutdown?
answer: No, your files will not be deleted. During renewal activities, each National Host Site will migrate /project and /home data from the existing storage system to the new storage system.

question: What happens to /project and /home data during renewal activities?
answer: Each National Host Site will migrate /project and /home data from the existing storage system to the new storage system once it is installed.

question: When do data migrations typically occur?
answer: These migrations typically occur during outages, but specific details may vary by National Host Site.

question: How will users be informed about data migration effects?
answer: Each National Host Site will keep users informed of any specific, user-visible effects related to data migrations.

question: What will happen to tape systems for backups and /nearline data?
answer: Tape systems for backups and /nearline data are not being replaced, so backups and /nearline data will remain unchanged.

question: Who can I contact for further technical questions about file migrations?
answer: For further technical questions, please email technical support. This goes directly to our ticketing system, where a support expert can provide a detailed response.

question: When will system outages occur during the infrastructure renewal?
answer: Each National Host Site will have its own schedule for outages as the installation of and transition to new equipment proceeds.

question: Where can I find information about specific system outages?
answer: Specific outages will be described on our system status web page: [https://status.alliancecan.ca].

question: How else will users receive updates and outage notices?
answer: Users will receive more general updates on this wiki page and periodically receive emails with updates and outage notices.

question: Whom should I contact for general questions about the transition?
answer: Contact our technical support. They will try their best to answer any questions they can.

question: Will my existing jobs and applications still be able to run on the new systems?
answer: Generally yes, but the new CPUs and GPUs may require recompilation or reconfiguration of some applications.

question: Will the standard software environment from current systems be available on the new systems?
answer: Yes, our standard software environment will be available on the new systems.

question: Will commercial, licensed software be migrated to the new systems?
answer: Yes, the plan is that the current commercial software licenses will be transitioned to the new replacement systems, providing identical access to applications like Gaussian and AMS/ADF.

question: Are there any risks regarding commercial software licensing on the new systems?
answer: There is a small risk that software providers will change their licensing terms for the new system. Such issues will be addressed individually as they come up.

question: Will there be staggered outages, or can overlapping outages be expected?
answer: While we will do our best to limit overlapping outages, due to delivery schedules and funding deadlines, there will probably be periods when several systems are simultaneously offline.

question: How will simultaneous outages be announced?
answer: Outages will be announced as early as possible.

question: Can I purchase old hardware after equipment upgrades?
answer: Most of the equipment is legally the property of the hosting institution, which typically manages its disposal through e-cycling (recycling) rather than selling it.

question: Who should I contact if I am looking to acquire old hardware?
answer: If you are looking to acquire old hardware, it's best to contact the host institution directly, as they may have specific policies or options for selling equipment.
